circle_bundles.LocalTrivResult

class circle_bundles.LocalTrivResult(f, valid, n_retries, n_landmarks, errors)[source]

Bases: object

Result container for local trivialization (circle-coordinate) computations.

This object is returned by compute_local_triv() and packages the per-cover-set circular coordinates together with diagnostic metadata.

Conventions

  • U has shape (n_sets, n_samples)

  • f has shape (n_sets, n_samples)

  • f[j, s] is meaningful only when U[j, s] is True

f

Local circular coordinates in radians, wrapped to [0, 2π). Values are only meaningful on samples belonging to the corresponding cover set.

Type:

ndarray of shape (n_sets, n_samples)

valid

Boolean mask indicating which cover sets were successfully coordinatized.

Type:

ndarray of shape (n_sets,)

n_retries

Number of retries used for each cover set (relevant for iterative methods such as Dreimac).

Type:

ndarray of shape (n_sets,)

n_landmarks

Number of landmarks ultimately used for each cover set (method-dependent; meaningful for Dreimac-based methods).

Type:

ndarray of shape (n_sets,)

errors

Mapping from cover-set index to error message for any set that failed to produce valid coordinates.

Type:

dict[int, str]

Notes

This class is intended as a lightweight, inspection-friendly summary of the local trivialization step. Most users will encounter it through higher-level bundle construction workflows.

__init__(f, valid, n_retries, n_landmarks, errors)
Parameters:

  • f (ndarray)

  • valid (ndarray)

  • n_retries (ndarray)

  • n_landmarks (ndarray)

Return type:
